title: Alexsw
author: Alexsw
content: I know 1 web suite and before was no problem to köpa bitcoin, but till finish, web site  tell them send all money, but i dond see them . Also this time (last) i order bitcoin from portebly wallet . Can Electrum see place my money is now and how to get then to wallet ?Thabk you i forhand and , have a nice weekend .

comments.author: NeuroticFish
comments.body: Quote from: Alexsw on May 20, 2022, 08:26:35 AMI know 1 web suite and before was no problem to köpa bitcoin, but till finish, web site  tell them send all money, but i dond see them . Also this time (last) i order bitcoin from portebly wallet . Can Electrum see place my money is now and how to get then to wallet ?Thabk you i forhand and , have a nice weekend . Did that platform you bought from give a transaction ID about your coins?It should be a long string that looks like this one: f7360e4fa149adb8354ffdc52e4ae511c37afdef8859d21a497118f0760201d2(I've just taken the transaction ID of a random transaction)If they did and you don't have a problem showing it, you can post that here (but please make sure you don't post private key).Or (if you have no problem showing) you can post the address you're expecting the coins arrive to (and again, please make sure you don't post private key).Or you can post the address or transaction Id to website like https://mempool.space/ and see for yourself if* the new transaction you expect did come* the new transaction is confirmed or not

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: Would you mind telling us what website or exchange your bitcoin came from?Also, can you check the Electrum if the circle in the bottom right of Electrum is green or red?I can't understand your post a bit can you use a translator? So that you can explain well about your issue.If your Electrum shows a red circle your wallet has a connection problem. Changing DNS usually fix this problem.

comments.author: nc50lc
comments.body: Try to post it in your local language for better support.There may be some mistranslations if everything has to be machine-translated.See if your language is in this list: http://bitcointalk.org/index.php#5 (local boards)

comments.author: NotATether
comments.body: It will also be helpful if you publish the name of the website you are buying bitcoins from. Then we can check their site policies to see if there is some requirement you must fulfill e.g. KYC, before it converts your money to Bitcoins.Note: If the website tells you to send more money to "unlock" or "process" the transaction, then it is a scam.

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: Quote from: Alexsw on May 20, 2022, 08:26:35 AMI know 1 web suite and before was no problem to köpa bitcoin, but till finish, web site  tell them send all money, but i dond see them . It seems that you speak Swedish (from the word köpa), so if you know someone who speaks English or any language in the local boards[1] it will help a lot.If you have completed withdrawing your coins from the platform, you will get TXID, ask them and make sure that the data contained in it is correct.[1] https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?board=11.0

comments.author: Pmalek
comments.body: Quote from: hugeblack on May 21, 2022, 08:22:03 AM<Snip> "Köpa" is indeed the Swedish word for "buy". OP obviously doesn't speak English, and the post is also not translated with google translate or a similar automated translation tool because it contains spelling mistakes. I would suggest you use Google translate and just post in your native Swedish language and paste the results here. It should provide more clarity.There is no Swedish local thread in the Other languages/locations sub that I am aware of.OP should use the Skandinavisk local if he wants to write in his mother tongue. The activity there is quite poor though.

comments.author: DireWolfM14
comments.body: Quote from: Pmalek on May 22, 2022, 08:47:46 AMQuote from: hugeblack on May 21, 2022, 08:22:03 AM~~Hopefully the OP figured things out, he hasn't been back online since 4 hours after posting this thread.  It also sounds like he was using the portable version of electrum, he may have been having trouble with derivation path and accounts.As for the rule against posting in your native tongue, or using google translate in the general boards; I think an exception should be made in the technical boards when asking for help.

comments.author: Pmalek
comments.body: Quote from: DireWolfM14 on May 22, 2022, 03:05:43 PMAs for the rule against posting in your native tongue, or using google translate in the general boards; I think an exception should be made in the technical boards when asking for help. I have seen people who don't speak English do it several times, so that really shouldn't be a problem why people could get in trouble with the Bitcointalk staff. Not everyone speaks English, but they still might require some help. I see it only becoming a problem if you start building your account by posting a lot of Google translated content. But in rare occasions where the person is probably only her to get help with Bitcoin, it's not a big deal. One call always mention that the post is Google translated and the reason why if that is a requirement.
